ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Which hand do you use to write with
Notes: 1= Right Always; 2 = Right most of time; 3= Both equally often; 4= Left most of the time; 5=Left always

ElementDescription: Which hand do you use to hold a nail when hammering
Notes: 1= Left Always; 2 = Left most of time; 3= Both equally often; 4= Right most of the time; 5=Right always

ElementDescription: Which hand do you use to throw a ball
Notes: 1= Right Always; 2 = Right most of time; 3= Both equally often; 4= Left most of the time; 5=Left always

ElementDescription: Which hand do you use to hold a bottle when removing the top
Notes: 1= Left Always; 2 = Left most of time; 3= Both equally often; 4= Right most of the time; 5=Right always

ElementDescription: Which hand do you use to draw with
Notes: 1= Right Always; 2 = Right most of time; 3= Both equally often; 4= Left most of the time; 5=Left always

ElementDescription: Which hand do you use to hold a potato when peeling
Notes: 1= Left Always; 2 = Left most of time; 3= Both equally often; 4= Right most of the time; 5=Right always

ElementDescription: Which hand do you use to hold a pitcher when pouring out of it
Notes: 1= Right Always; 2 = Right most of time; 3= Both equally often; 4= Left most of the time; 5=Left always

ElementDescription: Which hand do you use to hold scissors when cutting
Notes: 1= Right Always; 2 = Right most of time; 3= Both equally often; 4= Left most of the time; 5=Left always

ElementDescription: Which hand do you use to hold a knife when cutting food
Notes: 1= Right Always; 2 = Right most of time; 3= Both equally often; 4= Left most of the time; 5=Left always

ElementDescription: Which hand do you use to hold a needle when threading
Notes: 1= Left Always; 2 = Left most of time; 3= Both equally often; 4= Right most of the time; 5=Right always

ElementDescription: Which hand do you use to hold a drinking glass when drinking
Notes: 1= Right Always; 2 = Right most of time; 3= Both equally often; 4= Left most of the time; 5=Left always

ElementDescription: Which hand do you use to hold a tooth brush when brushing teeth
Notes: 1= Right Always; 2 = Right most of time; 3= Both equally often; 4= Left most of the time; 5=Left always

ElementDescription: Which hand do you use to hold a dish when wiping
Notes: 1= Left Always; 2 = Left most of time; 3= Both equally often; 4= Right most of the time; 5=Right always

ElementDescription: Which hand do you use to hold a tennis racquet when playing
Notes: 1= Right Always; 2 = Right most of time; 3= Both equally often; 4= Left most of the time; 5=Left always

ElementDescription: Crovitz scale Total Score
Handedness
Notes: 1=Right-handed (total score = 14-32) ; 2= Ambidextrous (total score = 33-49) ; 3= Left handedness (total score = 50-70)

ElementDescription: Did you ever switch handedness (by parents/teachers)? Why? When? How old were you?
